title: Oscar Pistorius trial: sentencing begins â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: 'pistorius wants to start his career again '
'pistorius should do 16 hours community work per month '
'the accused will benefit from correctional supervision '

documents.title: final summary
text: at the end of the first day of oscar pistorius 's sentencing hearing , here 's where we are : pistorius 's defence team has called three out of four witnesses to testify in mitigation of sentencing : a psychologist , a correctional services social worker , and the athlete 's manager .
social worker joel maringa told the court that he recommended pistorius undergo house arrest for three years , with 16 hours of community service per month .
the state 's gerrie nel , who will be pushing for the most punitive possible jail term , called this suggestion shockingly inappropriate .
pistorius 's psychologist and manager , respectively , have painted the of a broken man who is nonetheless humble and charitable , and who poses no danger to society .
tomorrow morning , when we resume , gerrie nel will have the opportunity to cross-examine pistorius 's manager peet van zyl .
after that , the defence is expected to call their final witness , whereafter the state will begin to lead their own witnesses in evidence .
judge thokozile masipa indicated at the beginning of today 's proceedings that she did not expect the hearing to last longer than one week .
thank you for following today 's coverage .
we 'll be back tomorrow .
reeva steenkamp 's mother june steenkamp is during the first day of the sentencing hearing for oscar pistorius in the pretoria high court .
/werner beukes/gallo/rex
milton nkosi ( @ nkosi milton ) barry roux leaving court after early adjournment .
correctional services recommends 3yr house arrest+community service

documents.title: court adjourns for the day
text: the first day of the sentencing hearing for oscar pistorius has come to an early close , with the prosecution 's gerrie nel requesting to stand the matter down so that he has time to study the thick report which manager peet van zyl has compiled on pistorius 's charity work .
judge masipa assents , and court is adjourned until 9.30am ( south africa time ) on tuesday .
if i can use the word bright ' , it would be an understatement .
pistorius 's agent peet van zyl , describing the athlete 's future prior to the shooting .
van zyl said that since the verdict was handed down , pistorius has lost every contract with sponsors .
he claims that he and pistorius have not discussed pistorius 's future career beyond the trial .

among the high-profile sporting figures who requested pistorius 's involvement in various charity endeavours were tennis player novak djokovic , former footballer bobby charlton and british olympic chief sebastian coe .
we may be here for a while : karyn maughan ( @ karynmaughan ) van zyl 's document on pistorius charity work is over a hundred pages long @ twitterid # oscartrial

documents.title: court resumes
text: in the last session of the day , pistorius 's manager peet van zyl has taken his place on the stand once again to continue testifying as to pistorius 's charity work .
defence lawyer barry roux arrives at the pretoria high for oscar pistorius ' sentencing at the high court in pretoria .
nsingo/demotix/corbis

from south africa , afp is reporting that if oscar pistorius is given a sentence of house arrest , it may cause resentment : a non-custodial sentence would be likely to spark public anger , fuelling a perception among black south africans that , 20 years after the end of apartheid , wealthy whites can still secure preferential justice .
at the end of the day a young lady was killed and someone should pay for it , said 57-year-old mildred lekalakala , a member of the women 's league of the ruling african national congress .
it 's the first day of oscar pistorius 's sentencing hearing , and three defence witnesses have appeared on the stand thus far to testify in mitigation of sentencing .
dr lore hartzenberg , who gave pistorius grief counselling after the shooting of reeva steenkamp , testified that the athlete was a broken man who was unlikely to fully recover .
dr hartzenberg said that pistorius never expressed any desire to pursue his athletics career post-trial , saying he hoped to work at a school in mozambique instead .

joel maringa , a state social worker , read from a report concluding that pistorius would be a good candidate for house arrest rather than a prison sentence though he should be declared unfit to own a gun .

maringa said he would advise that a sentence of house arrest not exceed three years , with pistorius made to carry out 16 hours of community service per month in the form of cleaning at local museums and hospitals .
maringa appeared to contradict dr hartzenberg 's testimony when he said that pistorius had told him he wished to return to professional athletics .
when we adjourned for lunch , pistorius 's manager peet van zyl was listing all the charity work pistorius has undertaken over the past few years .
if you need a recap of the potential sentences that pistorius can receive for culpable homicide , read our summary here .

documents.title: court adjourns for lunch
text: lunch break at the north gauteng high court .
after the hour 's recess , we 'll resume with pistorius 's manager peet van zyl still on the stand .
peet van zyl mentions the occasion in december 2012 when pistorius raced against a horse in qatar and won .
watch it here : the blade runner ' oscar pistorius takes on a racehorse in the qatari capital of doha and wins with more than a second to spare .
van zyl admits that this was not a charity project : my job was to make money for mr pistorius .
nastasya tay ( @ nastasyatay ) van zyl pushing all right buttons : painting a portrait of a humble , accommodating # oscarpistorius , who 'd go out of his way to help others .
mandy wiener ( @ mandywiener ) # oscartrial van zyl presenting portrait of op as charitable , humble , considerate detailing history of benevolence and generosity .
pistorius 's manager testifies that the athlete was due to launch his own charitable foundation in july 2013 , after working closely with the university of strathclyde in glasgow .
the university awarded pistorius an honorary doctorate in november 2012 .
at the time , pistorius said : the people of scotland are always so warm and welcoming towards me , and i think of it as my second home .

peet van zyl lists a number of charity initiatives that oscar pistorius participated in free of charge : among others , for unicef and cheshire homes , as well as charitable programmes for his sponsors .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) van zyl : nike had a slogan : `` if you 've got a body , you 're an athlete . ''
they saw mr # pistorius personified this slogan .
( after the shooting of steenkamp , nike had to withdraw an ad featuring pistorius with a more unfortunate slogan . )

documents.title: third defence witness called
text: the next witness on the stand is pistorius 's long-time manager peet van zyl , who also testified during the trial .
the defence 's barry roux tells the court that van zyl will be giving evidence on pistorius 's charity work , and the status of his athletic career .
with no further questions from the defence or the prosecution , judge masipa wants some more details on the community service that maringa envisages pistorius undertaking .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) masipa : community service .
what exactly would he be doing ?
maringa : basically it involves cleaning .
cleaning work outside the yard .

documents.title: 'pistorius wants to start his career again '
text: in contradiction to the testimony of previous witness dr lore hartzenberg , social worker joel maringa testifies that oscar pistorius told him that he wanted to return to athletics .
maringa suggested one reason why house arrest might be suitable would be because it would enable pistorius to continue to train .
when nel asked maringa how long he would recommend that pistorius undergo house arrest , he replied that three years would be suitable .
that is shockingly inappropriate , nel retorts .

while nel and maringa duke it out over whether or not maringa is sufficiently au fait with judge masipa 's findings in this matter , here 's a department of correctional services fact-sheet on what house arrest constitutes in south africa : house arrest refers to that portion of the day/night when the probationer does not work and is compelled to be at home .
the period of house arrest of individual probationers may differ .
the possible risk posed to the community is taken into account when determining the probationer 's placement under house arrest .
when the condition of house arrest is being set , the offender 's working hours are taken into account in order to avoid conflict between such hours and the period of house arrest .
flexibility is also built into the condition of house arrest to allow probationers to participate in organized sport activities , to attend church services , to do the necessary shopping , etc .
nel and maringa are quibbling over the details of the crimes of which pistorius was convicted .
nel asks how maringa can make a recommendation on appropriate penalties if he is unfamiliar with the findings of the court in this case .
barry bateman ( @ barrybateman ) # oscartrial it does n't appear maringa as read the judgment .
he is not aware of the details of the incident .
bb alex crawford ( @ alexcrawfordsky ) # oscartrial maringa may be the only south african who hasnt followed the pistorius trial minute by minute , gavel by gavel
the state 's gerrie nel will now cross-examine defence witness joel maringa .
andrew harding ( @ bbcandrewh ) what will nel do with maringa ?
tough one for prosecution given that he is a state employee provided by correctional services as witness .

documents.title: 'pistorius should do 16 hours community work per month '
text: state social worker maringa suggests that pistorius could undertake community service at the nearby transvaal museum ( currently known as the ditsong museum of natural history ) , or pretoria 's little company of mary hospital .

documents.title: 'pistorius should be declared unfit to possess a firearm '
text: state social worker joel maringa notes that while pistorius 's behaviour in general can be considered socially acceptable , this is tarnished by his track record with guns .
the athlete should not be allowed to own further guns , maringa recommends .

documents.title: 'the accused will benefit from correctional supervision '
text: correctional services social worker joel maringa says that pistorius would be a good candidate for house arrest , subject to strict conditions .
maringa reads out a potted cv of pistorius 's sporting career , including his paralympic successes .

gold medalist south africa 's oscar pistorius poses with a flag as he celebrates after winning the men 's 400 meters t44 category final during the athletics competition at the 2012 paralym dunham/associated press
maringa has prepared a report on the suitability of oscar pistorius undergoing house arrest , rather than a prison sentence .
he is about to start reading his findings .

documents.title: second defence witness called
text: the next witness has taken the stand .
his name is joel maringa , and he is a social worker in the department of correctional services .
roux says he has n't consulted with maringa before now .
maringa has no option but to allow his testimony to be broadcast on tv , because he is a public servant .
no further questions from gerrie nel to dr lore hartzenberg .

the defence 's barry roux now has his chance to re-examine his witness , but after being shut down for a leading question in attempting to counter the reports of pistorius 's new girlfriend , he says he has no further questions either .
hartzenberg concedes under questioning from nel that she cried during the trial while witnessing pistorius take his prosthetic legs off .
barry bateman ( @ barrybateman ) # oscartrial this line from nel speaks to proximity - whether she can provide court with objective opinion .
bb nastasya tay ( @ nastasyatay ) nel appears to land a bias blow .
dr h admits she got emotional , cried in court , as # oscarpistorius took off his prostheses .
barry bateman ( @ barrybateman ) # oscartrial oscar is writing down notes , shaking his head as he does so .
bb
nel asks hartzenberg if she has heard reports that pistorius already has a new lady friend , as alleged by uk tabloids at the trial 's outset .
hartzenberg says she did read about it , but pistorius never discussed it with her .
the reports claimed that pistorius had embarked on a relationship with a family friend after the two holidayed together in mozambique .

here 's south africa 's city press : a holiday maker in inhambane at the time told city press ' sister newspaper , rapport , that pistorius and [ the alleged girlfriend ] kept things discreet while they were together .
they were n't kissing or holding hands or anything .
their most intimate exchange was when they shared a bottle of water , the holiday maker said , adding the two were never alone and always part of a group .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) hartzenberg : `` if it was something that was very important to him , he would have discussed it with me .
he did n't . ''
# pistorius

documents.title: court resumes
text: after a longer than expected break , court is back in session in pretoria , with dr lore hartzenberg still on the stand .
judge thokozile masipa reads her verdict in the murder trial oscar pistorius murder trial at pretoria high court , pretoria , south africa .

the claim by pistorius 's psychologist that the athlete hopes to devote his future to working at a school in mozambique may raise some eyebrows , but pistorius has spoken before about his affection for the country which borders south africa .
speaking to the guardian in 2011 , pistorius said : i must admit i quite like mozambique , it 's pretty unspoiled , pretty rural .
it 's a beautiful place , really low-key and down-to-earth and the people are friendly .
i really enjoy it there , apart from the fact that there 's no cell phone signal , although i guess that might be a perk .
there are a couple of places that have captured my heart for different reasons , and that 's one of them .
south african paralympic athlete oscar pistorius arrives ahead of sentencing procedures on a charge of culpable homicide at the high court in pretoria , south africa , 13 october 2014 .
beukes/epa

here 's a video of oscar pistorius arriving at the north gauteng high court this morning : south african athlete oscar pistorius arrives at the high court in pretoria for sentencing on monday after being convicted of killing his girlfriend , reeva steenkamp .

documents.title: key points so far
text: while the pretoria court is in adjournment , here 's a summary of the most significant aspects of this morning 's proceedings in oscar pistorius 's sentencing hearing up till now .
the defence is likely to call four witnesses , and the prosecution at least two .
it is anticipated that matters will conclude within a week .

the defence 's first witness is pistorius 's personal psychologist dr lore hartzenberg , who began counselling the athlete after the shooting of steenkamp and has testified as to his stress , ptsd and depression , as well as his remorse and regret .
hartzenberg said that during their sessions , pistorius had not expressed any interest in resuming his career in professional athletics .
instead , he wanted to go and work at a school in mozambique .
pistorius carried photographs of steenkamp after the shooting , hartzenberg said .
court is adjourned for gerrie nel to consult with a state psychologist on the report delivered by dr hartzenberg .
we 'll be back at 11.15am south africa time in just over half an hour .
hartzenberg says that pistorius told her that reeva steenkamp was a model and involved in some projects .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) hartzenberg : i know she was from port elizabeth .
she loved horse riding and had a horse riding accident .
i know she was on a tv show .
hartzenberg concedes that she learnt most biographical information on steenkamp from media reports rather than pistorius , who only discussed his relationship with her .
she says pistorius carried photos of steenkamp with him .
nel wants to discuss a visit pistorius took to a johannesburg nightclub during his murder trial .
if pistorius was so traumatised by the global media scrutiny of him , why would he risk such an outing ?
hartzenberg suggests that such behaviour might reflect a desire to escape from trauma .
in his heart and mind , miss steenkamp was the one , hartzenberg says pistorius told her .
she concedes that he had serious relationships prior to steenkamp : he always had someone in his life .
nel has brought up pistorius 's ex-girlfriend samantha taylor , whose mother patricia has recently released a tell-all account of her relationship with the athlete .
it 's early days in the sentencing hearing , but gerrie nel is already adopting a decidedly combative approach to the defence 's first witness .

jerome starkey ( @ jeromestarkey ) counsellor may need counselling after another trademark mauling from the # oscarpistorius prosecutor gerrie nel , hungry for jail time in x-em rohit kachroo ( @ rohitkachrooitv ) booming nel questioning witness on what pistorius told her about the shooting .

feels like trial territory mandy wiener ( @ mandywiener ) ca n't help but feel that nel 's style and approach has n't been welcomed by masipa and he 's doing himself no favours by continuing with it .
dr hartzenberg says she is n't aware of pistorius ever receiving psychological help from a professional prior to the shooting .
nel asks if hartzenberg had a session with pistorius after the judgment .
she says they did , but they did n't discuss pistorius 's intentions in firing the gun .
alex crawford ( @ alexcrawfordsky ) # oscartrial doctor 's face looks flushed .
she 's clearly not very comfortable .
made a big point at start that she didnt want to give evidence
gerrie nel asks if hartzenberg has ever counselled families who lost a child .
he clearly wants to press the point that the trauma and pain of reeva steenkamp 's family should be taken into account alongside pistorius 's psychological suffering .
is it correct to say that pistorius will not pursue a future as a professional athlete , nel persists .
andrew harding ( @ bbcandrewh ) dr h says it was her `` impression '' that # oscarpistorius did not intend to resume his career .
nel remains incredulous .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) uncle arnold # pistorius , sitting forward , shakes his head as nel presses point about future plans .

documents.title: 'he did not show any inclination to continue with career '
text: under cross-examination from nel , dr hartzenberg has claimed that pistorius never expressed any desire to pursue an athletic career after the trial .
we took one day at a time , she says .
the international paralympic committee has said that they would have no objections to pistorius continuing to compete .
hartzenberg says the only thing pistorius mentioned about future plans was that it might bring him pleasure to work at a school that his uncle is affiliated with in mozambique .
with no further questions from pistorius 's lawyer barry roux , it is the turn of the prosecution 's gerrie nel to cross-examine dr lore hartzenberg .

documents.title: pistorius is unlikely to fully recover ' , says psychologist
text: pistorius 's personal psychologist dr lore hartzenberg has painted a of a man who will suffer persistent trauma as a result of the shooting and its legal aftermath .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) hartzenberg : `` what are we left with ?
we are left with a broken man who has lost everything . ''
# pistorius
a major theme of hartzenberg 's testimony so far has been a criticism of the effects of negative media coverage on pistorius .
the athlete feels that these reports were premised on inaccurate facts about the shooting .
i have never found [ pistorius ] to be anything other than a respectful , caring and well-mannered person , dr hartzenberg says .
she has never seen him lose his temper , but can testify to his anxiety .
david smith ( @ smithinafrica ) hartzenberg : i found his remorse and pain to be genuine .
without his family and god , he would not have been able to withstand pressure .
mr pistorius is essentially a lonely person psychologist dr lore hartzenberg
pistorius 's concern for reeva steenkamp 's parents was an unremitting theme of his therapy sessions .
hartzenberg stresses the athlete 's remorse , regret and feelings of being bereft without steenkamp , with whom he was planning a future .
mandy wiener ( @ mandywiener ) # oscartrial hartzenberg speaks to retching , emotional outbursts , perspiring - likely attempt by defence to give displays credence .
initially mr pistorius presented with acute stress reaction , hartzenberg reads from her report .
subsequently he showed signs of ptsd and depression .
pistorius manifested overwhelming guilt and remorse , and sometimes had to excuse himself from sessions due to retching while describing the shooting .
initially it was very difficult , says hartzenberg of her first sessions with pistorius .
he was very emotional .
her own voice seems to be wavering with emotion too .
when dr hartzenberg was approached to be a witness , her attitude was that as pistorius 's therapist , she was reluctant to become involved in the case .
after being requested to write a report on her observations of the athlete during psychotherapy , however , she decided to share her insights with the court .
hartzenberg has been seeing pistorius for around 18 months , starting sessions with him as a grief counsellor after the shooting of steenkamp .
oscar trial channel ( @ oscartrial199 ) # oscartrial hartzenberg lists her qualifications - she has a phd in cross-cultural trauma counselling in context of domestic violence .
pistorius 's lawyer barry roux has indicated that the defence will be calling three witnesses , with a potential fourth from the department of correctional services .
the prosecution 's gerrie nel has said that they will be calling at least two witnesses .
when judge masipa asked nel if he thought they would be able to wrap things up within a week , he replied : i hope so .
the first witness for the defence will be oscar pistorius 's personal psychologist , dr lore hartzenberg , who will not be shown on tv .
dr hartzenberg has been present at various points in the trial to comfort pistorius .

documents.title: court is in session
text: judge thokozile masipa has entered the courtroom and taken her seat .

documents.title: what happens at the sentencing hearing ?
text: the hearing will resemble a mini-trial , in the sense that both the prosecution and defence will call witnesses and present evidence in mitigation and aggravation of sentencing .
the defence will lead witnesses first .
these are expected to include medical experts and psychologists , to testify as to the extent of pistorius 's disability and his concomitant vulnerability .
they may also argue that pistorius 's high profile would make him a target in prison .

the prosecution 's witnesses will follow , and they may include firearms experts to testify as to pistorius 's negligence in firing blindly through a door and representatives from reeva steenkamp 's inner circle .
it is common in south african cases like this for the family of the victim to give evidence .
but the lawyer for reeva steenkamp 's parents , dup de bruyn , has told south african news channel enca that barry and june steenkamp will not take the stand .
when asked if the steenkamps would be called as witnesses by the state , de bruyn replied , no adding , i do n't think they are healthy enough to go through the trauma of being on the stand .
he said : anyone who has lost a child will be able to understand their trauma .
reeva steenkamp 's parents , barry and june steenkamp , listen to the verdict in the murder trial of oscar pistorius .
there are three days set aside for the hearing this week .
it 's possible that judge masipa may be ready to hand down sentence by wednesday , but she may also adjourn the court again to consider the evidence and set another date for sentencing thereafter .
a new addition to the pretoria courtroom today : a security scanner .
karyn maughan ( @ karynmaughan ) for first time , police have scanners at entrance of op court room .

believed to be in response to threats on pistorius life @ twitterid stephanie findlay ( @ sjfindlay ) security says there is `` not really '' a threat but says the security scanner in front of the # pistorius courtroom door is for our `` lives ''

documents.title: what outcome is expected ?
text: in south africa opinion among legal experts has been divided as to the sentence the judge is likely to hand down .
the majority of those surveyed by local newspaper the times predicted that pistorius would not see the inside of a jail cell .
others disagree , saying the athlete is looking at a potential 10-year jail sentence , though possibly part suspended .

factors likely to be considered by the judge in mitigation of sentencing include : that pistorius is a first-time offender ; that he has made a contribution to south african society through his sporting achievements ; that he is disabled and has medical needs which may not easily be met in prison ; and that he has displayed remorse for the shooting of steenkamp .
members of the ruling african national congress ( anc ) women 's league march in pretoria on the anniversary of the killing of reeva steenkamp , february 14 , 2014 .
the judge may also take into account south africa 's massively overcrowded prison system .
in 2013 the country was reported to have the highest prison population in africa .

the purpose of imprisonment is defined by south africa 's correctional services act as having the objective of enabling [ the offender ] to lead a socially responsible and crime-free life in the future .
pistorius has made his entrance at the pretoria court .
milton nkosi ( @ nkosi milton ) oscar pistorius arrives for his sentencing in pretoria .

documents.title: what sentence could pistorius receive ?
text: judge masipa has an enormous amount of discretion over what pistorius 's fate will be .
oscar pistorius could receive a prison sentence .
in south africa there is neither a minimum nor a maximum prison sentence for culpable homicide , despite the widely-reported notion that the prescribed maximum is 15 years .

sentences for culpable homicide do not tend to exceed 10 years : south african music star molemo jub jub maarohanye has just received a 10-year sentence after being found guilty of culpable homicide for killing four schoolchildren while drag racing .
pistorius could receive a suspended sentence .
if it is wholly suspended , this would see the athlete walk free , and stay free bar any misdemeanours .
if it is part suspended , he would still go to prison for a period .
pistorius could receive a non-custodial sentence .
in this scenario he would not do any jail time , but might be placed under a form of house arrest , made to report regularly to a police station , and/or undertake community service .
pistorius could receive a fine .

in 2013 , a former footballer for south africa 's national team , bryce moon , was fined r60 000 ( around â£ 3356 ) following his conviction for culpable homicide for having knocked down and killed zimbabwean domestic worker mavis ncube in his car .
viasen soobramoney 's report gives more detail as to what these scenarios might entail here .
welcome to the guardian 's live coverage of the sentencing of athlete oscar pistorius , who was found guilty of culpable homicide in south africa last month .

the north gauteng high court in pretoria will shortly reconvene to begin hearing arguments from the defence and the prosecution to determine the penalty pistorius will receive for the shooting of his girlfriend , reeva steenkamp , on 14 february 2013 in september , judge thokozile masipa cleared pistorius of murder but convicted him on the lesser charge of culpable homicide , akin to manslaughter in british law .
she also found him guilty on one charge of having negligently discharged a firearm in a crowded restaurant in johannesburg in january 2013 .
in finding pistorius guilty of culpable homicide , judge masipa said that by firing four shots through a locked toilet door , pistorius had acted too hastily and used excessive force .
in the circumstances , it is clear his conduct was negligent .
she added that his actions had not been those of a reasonable man .
however , she found that pistorius 's version of events that he had mistaken steenkamp for an intruder could reasonably , possibly be true .
there has been just over a month 's break between the delivery of the verdict and the beginning of the sentencing hearing today .
during this time pistorius has been keeping out of the spotlight at his uncle arnold pistorius 's house in pretoria , after the prosecution 's attempt to have his bail revoked failed .
the guardian 's david smith is in court in pretoria .
follow him on twitter for updates and breaking news - @ twitterid and read his report on the trial that had everything here .
reeva steenkamp , in johannesburg in 2012 .
gallo images/rex features images / rex features

bulletin.text: Rolling coverage as the judge decides whether Pistorius should be jailed for the culpable homicide of Reeva Steenkamp.
